pages.title: Clouds
pages.text: You have long known that heating water creates steam. But what if you heat a lot of water? Or rather, its snowy counterpart? With enough vapor a cloud forms.
The resulting cloud block is extremely fragile and crumbles at the slightest misstep, but if you crouch carefully you can even walk on it.

There is another way to get it. Stand on a magma block and toss a snow block: it vaporizes at once and turns into a cloud block. It takes time - and hurts - unless you have boots.$(br2)Cloud blocks can be compacted for storage or for something more useful.
